description.narrative: Tafakkar, which means ‘Think’ in Arabic, builds on the success and incorporates lessons learned from the pilot Esma’ni (‘Listen to Me’) programme. Youth beneficiaries from underserved areas in Ma’an and Karak will participate in Tafakkar and develop skills through the comprehensive, experiential training programme. After the capacity-building component, participants will be assisted and mentored to implement online and offline media and community initiatives that will strengthen their sense of belonging and agency, pride in their heritage, and 21st century skills and ability to engage positively for the betterment of their communities. The training consists of modules in active citizenship, critical thinking, media and information literacy or ‘Learn to Discern’ (L2D), and ideation design. The programme will hold small-group ideation workshops where participants identify and develop their project ideas. The training programme will culminate in a ‘Souq Al Afkar’ (Ideas Marketplace), an event to showcase participants’ plans for their media and cultural heritage projects. Tafakkar will then support production of media projects and implementation of community initiatives over a period of three months.

sector.narrative: 100 youth will participate in the training, and will receive training in critical information consumption skills, active citizenship and design thinking skills, they will also increase their awareness and appreciation of local heritage. Ten youth led community initiatives will be implemented during Tafakkar.

Tafakkar builds capacities of youth participants to enable them to be more conscientious consumers of information and creators of vibrant information. In total ten media products will be produced and disseminated by the end of the programme.

Tafakkar will train 12 facilitators (six from each governorate) in a Training of Trainers, and 100 youth from underserved areas in Southern Jordan in critical thinking, active citizenship, design thinking. Both the TOT and youth trainings will be assessed through pre/post and retrospective questionnaires.
